name: BEST WESTERN Art Hotel

reviews.text: The location is great, near city center and bars/restaurants, 15 minutes walk to the beach. The room is not big, but very clean and I love their design for the bed table.
reviews.title: Great Location, friendly staff, good Quality/Price

reviews.text: We have just returned from a trip to Britany. We stayed one night at this hotel. we took the comfort rooms 1 for us and 1 for my father. the rooms were so tiny that we had to put the chair out of the bay window there are mere 40 cm between the end of the bed to the wall. the price was definiyely too high for that room. the only nice thing was the nice Skotish young man in the reception he was very helpful were he could help.
reviews.title: not so comfortable in the comfort rooms

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed overnight at this city-centre hotel en route from the Channel Tunnel to Brittany. We were travelling with elderly parents. The refurbished rooms were excellent, slightly quirky decor in line with Art Hotel name, but practical. Our third floor room at the front had some road noise early morning, but if we hadn't had the window open, we probably wouldn't have been disturbed. Le Volcan, an electronic night club, is across the road, but any noise stopped before 11pm.
reviews.title: Very pleasant overnight stay

likes.disliked: — Not able to park at the hotel itself. There is no designated unloading area at the entrance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lift seems to be a shower, which is a bit disconcerting, complete with bathrobe!
reviews.title: Not a good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly, though in French. There was a kettle and assortment of teas and instant coffee in the room. We had a good rate incl. breakfast through the Best Western site and the breakfast was good with adequate hot and cold choices plus the usual continental breakfast selections.
reviews.title: moderrn normandy
Read the fine print
reviews.text: Tried to find an affordable yet quaint place in Honfleurs. When unsuccessful, searched the web, and the description of the Bordeau looked appealing. NO, it does NOT look over any water or harbors! We had to ask for towels for the two of us, despite a reservation indicating a couple. At 82 euros, this was 'costly' compared to its amenities. Do some more searching: I know you can find better than this. Oh! Car park locked in the a.m. - had to wait for someone to show up and unlock!
Comfortable Hotel, Central location, Value for Money, Friendly staff
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel, Central location, Value for Money, Friendly staff

reviews.text: I first found this hotel in November of 2011 and now stay at this hotel at least 10 nights per month, the staff are very friendly which is one of the reasons I return here.
reviews.title: Good value crazy lift free wifi

reviews.text: Central to many of the towns restaurants, Only a short walk to the sea front and beach
reviews.title: Trendy Gem

reviews.text: Breakfast is varied, choices from cerials, fruit, meat and cheese and choice also of some hot food.
reviews.title: Fantastic downtown hotel!

description: in the city center of UNESCO's world Patrimony quarter - right by restaurants and shopping area - minutes away from sea front and beaches restaurant - let's discover L.H. Le Havre in Normandie !
